page.title: 04Wildlife In Kennethmont 2.
page.content: Numerous species of wild animals are found in the Kennethmont area. The farmland is home to many hares, and voles while the wood and bog areas shelter red squirrels, roe deer,mice, hedgehogs,rats,wildcats (not ferral cats),foxes,stoats,weasels,rabbits, mice and rats seem to be widespread throughout the area. There are no otters now and if there are badgers or mink they are not common.Frogs and newts are numerous but we cannot comment on the numbers of snakes or lizards having seen none and having heard from no-one who has.There is no evidence in this area of agricultural chemicals(fertilizers,weedkillers,pest controls,etc.) having done any serious damage to the environment. There have recently been sightings of a large unidentified animal in the woods at Leith Hall,a haggis perhaps?
